question: Who introduced the Structuralist Model of Marxian Analysis?
explanation: Louis Althusser introduced Structuralist Model of Marxian Analysis and held that relation between base (Family, church, school, etc) and superstructure (Executive, legislature and Judiciary) are interdependent. he also argued that revolution should start either in the base or any part of the superstructure and would prelocate to the whole set of Base - Superstructure complex.
